cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest to northwest, pass south of Cuba, cross or clip northern Yucatan late Monday, then accelerate northwestward into the central Gulf of Mexico and toward the central Gulf Coast (LA-MS) by Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast near southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico including Cozumel (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Pinar del Rio, Cuba (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Caribbean, western Cuba, northern Yucatan Peninsula, central Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Virginia not listed in probability table)
weather_observation.wind: None – gale-force winds not expected at the port within 5-day window
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – surge threat confined to Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant rainfall possible late week, but heavy totals not indicated
weather_observation.other_hazards: None expected that would significantly affect operations at Virginia, VA, Port of
